intro: Hymenosicyos subsericeus, commonly known as the velvetleaf gourd, is a flowering plant in the Cucurbitaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, velvety pubescence. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its fruit is a rough, spiny gourd that can grow up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas and is often found in disturbed habitats.
